bibl.title: Letter from Elizabeth L. Ireland to Emilie Lawrence Reed, August 22, [19--]

div1.p: Ireland thanks Emilie Lawrence Reed for the gift and the visit to Blue Ridge Summit.

div1.head: Letter from Elizabeth L. Ireland to Emilie Lawrence Reed, August 22, [19--]
div1.p:
I just cannot
believe that this lovely
bag is really mine!
It is too precious for
words and how I can
ever bring myself to
put a damp wash cloth
in it. I do not know,
Anyway I shall be too
proud for words to carry
it, on my next trip
- wherever that may
be - and shall think
of you many, many
times. You are so
good to put all there
stitches into something
for me and I assure
you I greatly appreciate
every stitch!

I would have written
you two days ago but
my only writing desk
has been filled with
the paper hangers “stuff” and
I could not get within
six feet of it. Such a rulis
as we have been in but it
is most over.

We had such a delightful
day with you and Blossom
and did so enjoy your dear
little home and lovely garden
- and the delicious dinner.
Have had some awfully hot
days since that wonderfully
cool one up there.

Fortunately this work
of paper hangers and
printers, has been quite
cool - otherwise I think
I would have fired
them all out The first
day - so I could get
out of my clothes!!!

Much love to you both
and many, many Thanks
for this beautiful gift- It
came my birthday week!
